title: Butter Chicken
instructions:
Step 1: Marinate the chicken with ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, and salt for at least 30 minutes.
Step 2: In a pan, heat butter and add the tomato puree. Cook for 10 minutes until the oil separates.
Step 3: Add the marinated chicken and cook until it's tender and fully cooked.
Step 4: Stir in the cream, garam masala, and crushed kasuri methi.
Step 5: Simmer for 5 more minutes and serve hot with naan or rice.

title: Filter Coffee
instructions:
Step 1: Add coffee powder to the upper chamber of the coffee filter. Press down gently with the plunger.
Step 2: Pour hot water over it and cover. Let the coffee decoction drip down to the lower chamber for about 10 minutes.
Step 3: Pour 1/4 cup of the strong decoction into a tumbler.
Step 4: Add hot milk and sugar to taste.
Step 5: Pour back and forth between the tumbler and davara to create a froth. Serve hot.

title: Shahi Paneer
instructions:
Step 1: Saute paneer cubes until lightly golden and set aside.
Step 2: In a pan, heat oil and add ginger-garlic paste, followed by tomato puree and cashew paste. Cook for 10 minutes.
Step 3: Add turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.
Step 4: Stir in cream and fried paneer cubes. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

title: Dal Makhani
instructions:
Step 1: Soak lentils and kidney beans overnight. Pressure cook until very soft.
Step 2: Heat butter in a pan, saute onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook well.
Step 3: Add the cooked lentils and beans. Mash slightly and simmer for at least 30 minutes.
Step 4: Stir in cream and serve hot with a dollop of butter.

title: Aloo Gobi
instructions:
Step 1: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add onions and cook until translucent.
Step 2: Add potatoes and cauliflower, saute for 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 4: Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.

title: Samosa
instructions:
Step 1: Make a stiff dough with flour, salt, 4 tbsp oil, and water. Rest for 30 minutes.
Step 2: For filling, heat oil, add cumin seeds, ginger paste, peas, and mashed potatoes. Add spices and mix well.
Step 3: Roll out small discs from the dough, cut in half, and form into cones. Stuff with the potato filling and seal the edges.
Step 4: Deep fry on low-medium heat until golden brown and crisp.

title: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: 1 cup chopped mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, capsicum)
instructions:
Step 1: Boil and mash potatoes and mixed vegetables.
Step 2: Heat butter in a large pan, saute onions until golden. Add tomato puree and cook.
Step 3: Add pav bhaji masala and the mashed vegetables. Add water, mash well, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Step 4: Toast the pav buns with butter on a tawa.
Step 5: Serve the hot bhaji with pav, chopped onions, and a lemon wedge.

title: Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani
ingredients: a pinch of saffron soaked in milk
instructions:
Step 1: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, half the fried onions, mint, and coriander. Let it rest for at least 1 hour.
Step 2: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add soaked rice and cook until it is 70% done. Drain the rice and set aside.
Step 3: In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer the marinated chicken at the bottom.
Step 4: Spread the partially cooked rice over the chicken. Top with remaining fried onions, mint, coriander, and the saffron-infused milk.
Step 5: Cover the pot with a tight lid and cook on low heat (dum) for 25-30 minutes. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Chole Bhature
instructions:
Step 1: Pressure cook the soaked chickpeas with salt and a tea bag (for color) until soft.
Step 2: For bhature, mix flour, yogurt, a pinch of salt, and baking soda. Knead into a soft dough using warm water. Let it rest for 2 hours.
Step 3: For chole, heat oil, saute onions, add ginger-garlic paste, and then tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Step 4: Add chole masala and cooked chickpeas. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Step 5: Roll out the dough into oval shapes and deep fry in hot oil until the bhature puff up and turn golden brown. Serve hot with chole.

title: Idli Sambar
instructions:
Step 1: Grease idli molds and pour batter into each. Steam for 10-12 minutes until cooked.
Step 2: Pressure cook toor dal with vegetables, turmeric, and water until soft.
Step 3: In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds. Once they splutter, add onions and cook.
Step 4: Add cooked dal-veg mixture, sambar powder, tamarind pulp, and salt. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 5: Serve hot idlis with a bowl of sambar.

title: Gulab Jamun
instructions:
Step 1: For syrup, boil sugar, water, and cardamom until slightly sticky. Keep warm.
Step 2: Mix milk powder, flour, and baking soda. Rub in the ghee. Knead into a soft, smooth dough using milk.
Step 3: Make small, crack-free balls from the dough.
Step 4: Deep fry the balls in ghee or oil on very low heat until golden brown.
Step 5: Drop the fried jamuns directly into the warm sugar syrup. Let them soak for at least 2 hours.

title: Dhokla
ingredients: For tempering: 1 tbsp oil, 1 tsp mustard seeds, a few curry leaves, 2 slit green chilies
instructions:
Step 1: Make a smooth batter with gram flour, yogurt, turmeric, ginger-chili paste, salt, and water. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
Step 2: Just before steaming, add fruit salt to the batter and mix gently.
Step 3: Pour the batter into a greased steaming tray and steam for 15-20 minutes.
Step 4: Let it cool, then cut into squares.
Step 5: For tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Pour this over the dhoklas.

title: Rogan Josh
instructions:
Step 1: Heat oil/ghee in a pressure cooker. Fry onions until deep golden brown.
Step 2: Add the mutton pieces and sear on high heat.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and powdered spices. Saute for a few minutes.
Step 4: Whisk yogurt and add it to the pot, stirring continuously. Add salt and water.
Step 5: Pressure cook for 20-25 minutes or until the meat is tender.

title: Malai Kofta
ingredients: For Kofta: 200g paneer grated, 2 boiled potatoes mashed, nuts and raisins for stuffing
For Gravy: 2 onions, 2 tomatoes, 10-12 cashews, 1/4 cup cream, ginger-garlic paste
instructions:
Step 1: Mix paneer, potatoes, salt, and cornflour. Make balls, stuff with nuts, and deep fry until golden. These are the koftas.
Step 2: For the gravy, make a paste of boiled onions, tomatoes, and cashews.
Step 3: Heat oil, saute ginger-garic paste, then add the prepared paste. Cook until oil separates.
Step 4: Add powdered spices, salt, and water to achieve desired consistency. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 5: Finish the gravy with cream. Place koftas in a serving bowl and pour the hot gravy over them just before serving.

title: Poha
instructions:
Step 1: Rinse poha in a strainer and let it sit for 5-10 minutes to soften.
Step 2: Heat oil, add mustard seeds. When they pop, add peanuts and saute until crunchy. Add onions and potatoes.
Step 3: Cook until potatoes are tender. Add turmeric powder.
Step 4: Add the softened poha, salt, and sugar. Mix gently until everything is well combined.
Step 5: Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes. Squeeze lemon juice and garnish with coriander before serving.

title: Jalebi
ingredients: For Syrup: 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, saffron strands
instructions:
Step 1: Make a thick, smooth batter with flour, besan, yeast, and warm water. Let it ferment in a warm place for 1 hour.
Step 2: Prepare a one-string consistency sugar syrup with sugar, water, and saffron.
Step 3: Pour the fermented batter into a squeeze bottle or piping bag.
Step 4: Heat ghee in a flat pan. Squeeze the batter in circular motions to form jalebis.
Step 5: Fry on medium heat until crisp and golden on both sides. Immediately dip in warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds. Serve hot.

title: Tandoori Chicken
instructions:
Step 1: Make deep gashes on the chicken pieces. Apply salt, lemon juice, and red chili powder. Set aside for 30 minutes.
Step 2: Prepare a second marinade with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, tandoori masala, and food color.
Step 3: Coat the chicken pieces thoroughly with the yogurt marinade and refrigerate for at least 3-4 hours, or overnight.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Grill the chicken for 25-30 minutes, turning once, until cooked through and charred in places.
Step 5: Baste with butter and serve with onion rings and mint chutney.

title: Vada Pav
instructions:
Step 1: For the vada filling, mash potatoes. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, ginger-chili paste, and turmeric. Add this tempering to the potatoes and mix. Form into balls.
Step 2: Make a thick batter with gram flour, salt, turmeric, and water.
Step 3: Dip the potato balls in the batter and deep fry until golden brown.
Step 4: Slit the pav buns, spread dry garlic chutney inside.
Step 5: Place a hot vada inside the pav and serve immediately.

title: Kheer
ingredients: 1/4 cup basmati rice washed and soaked
instructions:
Step 1: Bring milk to a boil in a heavy-bottomed pan.
Step 2: Add the soaked rice. Simmer on low heat, stirring frequently, until the rice is cooked and the milk has thickened (about 30-40 minutes).
Step 3: Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron. Cook for another 5-7 minutes until the sugar dissolves.
Step 4: Garnish with chopped nuts.
Step 5: Serve warm or chilled.

title: Fish Curry
instructions:
Step 1: Marinate the fish pieces with salt and turmeric powder.
Step 2: Heat mustard oil in a pan until it smokes slightly. Lightly fry the fish pieces on both sides until golden. Set aside.
Step 3: In the same oil, add mustard seeds. Once they splutter, add the mustard paste, turmeric, and chili powder. Cook for a minute.
Step 4: Add chopped tomato and cook until soft. Add 1 cup of water and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Gently slide the fried fish into the gravy. Simmer for 5-7 minutes. Garnish with coriander and serve with steamed rice.
